entry.title: Prerender: Do not invoke show/hide/unload events on prerender cancellation
entry.content:
As it's hard for prerendered pages to ensure triggering events on

cancellation, we decided not to trigger unload events on cancellation.

Also, show/hide should not be triggered while prerendering, but these

are unexpected dispatched before the unload events.



This CL adds explicit code to omit their handling to make the behavior

stable.



Bug: 1222551, 1289245

entry.title: Fix :has() invalidation error with nesting parent containing hover
entry.content:
Sets ContainsPseudoInsideHasPseudoClass flag of a :has() selector if its

argument contains nesting parent.



Currently, the CSSSelectorParser doesn't set the above flag if the :has()

selector's argument has a nesting parent selector and the nesting parent

contains a pseudo selector.



Due to this, even if the pseudo state in the nesting parent is changed,

StyleEngine skips :has() invalidation for the pseudo state change because

the :has() anchor element doesn't have AffectedByPseudoInHas flag set.



To fix this, CSSSelectorParser sets ContainsPseudoInsideHasPseudoClass

flag if the :has() selector contains a nesting parent selector in its

argument selector.



Bug: 1517866

Change-Id: I41b6f69a83db41a4e519490018bfb214a724f807

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5203146

Reviewed-by: Rune Lillesveen

Commit-Queue: Byungwoo Lee

entry.title: media/gpu/vaapi: Support frame drop in VP9 encoding
entry.content:
This CL adds frame drop support to VA-API VP9 encoding. It is worth

noting that the libvpx rate controller judges if a frame is to be

dropped on a bottom spatial layer and if it is dropped, then all the

upper spatial layers are dropped.



Bug: b:280363228

Test: video_encode_accelerator_tests --codec=vp9 with various svc_mode

Test: webrtc playground with --enable-features=VideoEncoderFrameDrop

entry.title: Avoid that AxTreeSourceViews members become dangling.
entry.content:
This CL fixes two dangling pointers:

1) AxTreeSourceViews::cache_, which became dangling during the call to

AutomationManagerAura::Disable, since the cache was destroyed just

prior to resetting the tree that kept a reference to the cache.

2) AxTreeSourceViews::root_: In this case the issue was the shutdown

order of Widget. root_ points to an AXWidgetObjWrapper that observes

the widget that (indirectly, in a chain starting with its RootView)

owns AxTreeSourceViews. AxWidgetObjWrapper observes the Widget and,

in OnWidgetDestroying, calls the cache that owns the

AxWidgetObjWrapper and requests its own deletion. Since the call to

OnWidgetDestroying happens prior to the call to delete the RootView,

AxTreeSourceViews' pointer to root_ becomes dangling.

This CL fixes that by storing the AxWidgetObjWrapper's unique ID

instead of a pointer to it and uses the ID to look up the object

in cache_ when needed.



Bug: 1469136

Change-Id: I387148529b0e2ed349b510f8b313ae6e98ebcd34

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5192007

Auto-Submit: Jan Keitel

Reviewed-by: Elly FJ

Commit-Queue: Jan Keitel

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

entry.title: Privacy Sandbox GA Cleanup: Deprecate trials test setup method
entry.content:
This CL removes the old privacy sandbox trials setup method. Some tests

were affected by this change including the attribution reporting debug

mode test. Setting the cookie exception manually caused the test to fail

due to feature enabled states overlapping. The CL introduced a new test

suite to parameterise the test instead of a loop to ensure the overlap

doesn't happen.

entry.title: [PA] Create "Internal Partition" for metadata management
entry.content:
`ThreadCache`, Lightweight Quarantine and PCScan is using heap allocated

memory from Partition Allocator to manage their internal metadata.

Using the default partition for these data can result in reentrancy

issues.



This CL defines "Internal Partition" and forward allocations for

`ThreadCache` and Lightweight Quarantine to the new partition.

I will send a separate patch to rewrite PCScan (due to its size).

entry.title: ozone: dnd: decouple DataAvailable from Enter event
entry.content:
Until now, dnd code for each ozone platform must suppress platform

events until the advertised drag data is fully fetched from the drag

source/compositor. That very same functionality is mostly implemented at

views' DesktopDragDropClientOzone, except for a few missing bits.

Besides leading to duplicated logic at platform code, handing that at

that level over-complicates platform code with no real advantage. On

Wayland backend, for example, it has been a source of subtle bugs.



With this CL, basically the event suppressing responsibility is moved

all the way up to DesktopDragDropClientOzone, by decoupling original

WmDropHandler's OnDragDataFetched from OnDragEnter, as well as updating

their impls accordingly. At ozone platform level, both for x11 and

wayland, the call-sites are kept basically as is for now, so real

decoupling there will be done in follow-up CLs, where more cleanups and

code simplification should be made possible as well.



No behavioral change is expected, so no new tests added.



R=sky



Bug: 1487784

Change-Id: I86099ac807a40b2001632a0cec0105322ea535cd

entry.title: [AsyncSB] Show subresource warnings based on is_subresource.
entry.content:
Currently, the subresource warning string is determined by

is_main_frame_load_blocked, which is not equivalent to is_subresource.

For example, if the threat type is

SB_THREAT_TYPE_URL_CLIENT_SIDE_PHISHING, even though the warning is

triggered by the mainframe URL, is_main_frame_load_blocked is false so

the subresource warning string is shown. This issue will be more

prevalent after we enable async check.



Also rename is_main_frame_load_blocked to

is_main_frame_load_pending so the name is consistent with the function

name IsMainPageLoadPending.



Bug: 1512197

entry.title: Lazily create the TextureLayer for WebGPU
entry.content:
If the TextureLayer of canvas already created, its background color

will be drawn to the layer. But if TextureLayer has no texture, this

layer can not be composited. This CL delays creating TextureLayer for

WebGPU until GetNewTexture, ensuring TextureLayer can be composited.

entry.title: Audio: Set correct channel layout for 4 channel audios
entry.content:
On macOS, Audio MIDI only support setup 4 channel layout as

Quadraphonic(kAudioChannelLayoutTag_Quadraphonic) which equals to

"CHANNEL_LAYOUT_2_2" in FFMPEG/Chrome. FFMPEG and Chrome will guess

4 channel layout as "CHANNEL_LAYOUT_QUAD" which will always result

in silent channel 3/4 output on Macs.



On Windows, the system also support setup 4 channel layout as

Quadraphonic(KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_QUAD) which equals to "CHANNEL_LAYOUT_QUAD"

in FFMPEG/Chrome, so there is not such issue on Windows.



Manual test steps:

1. Create a Aggregate Device with 4 channel count and Quadraphonic layout.

2. Before the fix, play "bear-opus-end-trimming-4ch-channelmapping2.webm"

has no channel 3/4 sound output.

3. Before the fix, using script in https://crbug.com/1515122#c16

has no channel 3/4 sound output.

4. After the fix, play the same file, has 3/4 channel sound output.

5. After the fix, using the same script, has 3/4 channel sound output.



Bug: 1515122

Change-Id: Ic86876788bec13bcf63d776ab3561645a9e8fdaf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5196930

entry.title: [PA] Support building allocator_shim.dll.
entry.content:
PS6 = baseline



Split allocator_shim.cc into the following files:

- allocator_shim.cc (linux, chromoes, fuchsia)

- allocator_shim_apple.cc (MacOSX, iOS)

- allocator_shim_android.cc (Android)

- allocator_shim_win_static.cc (Windows)

- allocator_shim_win_component.cc (Windows component build)



Because of DLL-import and DLL-export conflict, we cannot

implement malloc() in a source which includes malloc.h.

So allocator_shim_win_component.cc doesn't include malloc.h.

Instead it depends on allocator_shim_win.cc and the file

does atomic, checked math and so on, which causes including

malloc.h)



Bug: 1429450

entry.title: [Files F2] Fix console error when open Android app
entry.content:
chrome.fileManagerPrivate.selectAndroiPickerApp requires the

parameter type to be chrome.fileManagerPrivate.AndroidApp, but

the one we passed previously is the extended AndroidApp type which

has an additional "icon" field, so before passing it to the

private API, we need to remove the "icon" field, otherwise there

will be an console error.



Open Gmail (Andriod version) from ChromeOS and compose a new

email, then attach a file to open file picker, in the opened file

picker, click "Photos" item from the directory tree.

entry.content:
This reverts commit 0b077528c3cf7ac40b43673fafb8364f5f6b17a0.



Reason for revert: I speculatively reverted the original CL. But

it seems my idea was wrong. The sync_integration_tests failure has

disappeared even before the reverting CL landed at r1247954.





Original change's description:

> Revert "[Shortstand] Run WebAppIntegrationTest with Shortstand flag off."

>

> This reverts commit 247acf8a4fc243d263f3dacd32b47a6e0e83cbcb.

>

> Reason for revert: speculatively reverting for crbug.com/1518797 and crbug.com/1518931

>

> Bug: 1518797, 1518931

>

> Original change's description:

> > [Shortstand] Run WebAppIntegrationTest with Shortstand flag off.

> >

> > This CL makes the WebAppIntegrationTest to always run with Shortstand

> > flag off even after it is enabled by default. This is because Shortstand

> > changes the behaviour of shortcuts, which would need significant changes

> > to WebAppIntegrationTest, and our long term goal is to remove the

> > shortcut support entirely from WebAppIntegrationTest. So instead of

> > update all the tests to support it, we will write separate integration

> > tests to cover the new cases and leave this flag off in the existing

> > tests.

entry.title: Move kDeprecateUnloadAllowlist parameter to a separate feature.
entry.content:
This adds a new parameter, `kDeprecateUnloadByAllowlist`, which controls whether the allow-list is used and the allow-list is attached to this parameter.



Having it on the mains kDeprecateUnload features means we have to provide the list in every finch group. This will cause a blow-up in finch data size.



We would enabled kDeprecateUnloadByAllowlist for 100% of users and pass the allow list once to all users.



Fixed: 1518694

Change-Id: I2ab982fb26a5b2626b79eec56bd99621dadbba6d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5199433

entry.title: [blink_apis] Sort `depends_on` list.
entry.content:
`blink_api_proto.py` serializes Blink API metadata using as a textproto.

Some repeated fields may wind up with non-deterministic ordering thereby

causing the resulting API list of to be unstable.



To address this, ideally we should enforce a deterministic ordering on all

repeated fields of the API metadata message. However in practice the

ordering is enforced implicitly for most of the fields other than

`IDLType.depends_on`.



Change-Id: Id2e350c9037dfc8ba238c119ad4133a17b4b79b0

Fixed: 1518420

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5201589

Reviewed-by: Paul Jensen

Commit-Queue: Asanka Herath

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1247964}

entry.title: media/BitstreamBufferMetadata: Add end_of_picture
entry.content:
This CL adds |end_of_picture| to BitstreamBufferMetadata. It is false

if a frame is not on the top spatial layers in SVC encoding.

Vp9Metadata originally has the end_of_picture variable because Chrome

hardware encoders support SVC encoding only in VP9 today.

The reason why the variable is moved to BitstreamBufferMetadata is a

drop frame support. When a frame is dropped, a hardware encoder should

not set the codec specific metadata because it may make a client

misunderstand that it progress on a temporal layer structure.

However, the end_of_picture variable is important to notify a client

that it is the last frame in spatial layers. So we need to let

BitstreamBufferMetadata has it regardless of the codec metadata.



Bug: b:280363228

Test: media_unittests

Change-Id: I5ac108d9676db115137f33bf2ee4f3bf41776bd7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5151643

entry.title: [BRP] Finchify "same slot" mode
entry.content:
In the current implementation, the only difference between "same slot"

and "previous slot" modes is end of which slot we look for ref-count.

This means that when MTE is on, we still bloat up ref_count_size to

the granule size and skip tagging it, even though it is no longer

necessary in the "same slot" mode. In the final code, we will no

longer do that, but we have to make sure that calculating the

entry.title: Improve property transition update calculation of transition:all
entry.content:
For transition:all, the standard properties to calculate update is

filtered by PropertiesForTransitionAll(), which will have a check on

IsAnimationAffectingProperty(). All the filtered properties stored

in the static |properties| will return false on such check. So we

can bypass this check in CalculateTransitionUpdateForPropertyHandle()

to reduce the repeated overhead for standard properties update of

transition:all.



This CL could improve the Speedometer3 NewsSite-Next/Nuxt subcases by

0.5~1.0%.



Change-Id: I72781e3eb5b17031fee26f591a8421c629a1412f

entry.title: Fix the broken tests when AppStorage is enabled(Part 22).
entry.content:
AppEventsObserver observes OnAppUpdate via AppPlatformMetrics. Well,

some apps could be added before AppPlatformMetrics observes

AppRegistryCache, and those apps added at the early stage are not

observed by AppEventsObserver, e.g.

1. AppA, AppB, AppC are added

2. AppPlatformMetrics/AppEventsObserver observe AppRegistryCache.

3. AppD is added.

Then only AppD is added to AppEventsObserver.



When the AppStorage feature is enabled, AppService blocks the app

publishing until it's ready, after reading from the AppStorage file.

So when AppA, AppB and AppC are added in the previous session, they

can be added to AppEventsObserver, because the they are published not

so early:

1. AppPlatformMetrics/AppEventsObserver observe AppRegistryCache.

2. AppA, AppB, AppC are added

3. AppD is added.

So all those apps are added to AppEventsObserver.



This affects the test

AppEventsObserverBrowserTest.ReportPreinstalledApp, as it checks app

account. So modify the code for the AppStorage feature:

1. Modify AppEventsObserver to use AppService apps result when the

AppStorage is enabled.

2. Modify the tests code to align with the AppStorage feature.



BUG=1385932, b:307623506



Change-Id: Id1cfba716f9960d7127e2b008a89d12461e26012

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5175092

Commit-Queue: Nancy Wang

entry.title: Revert "Make the event type check for d&d more explicit"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 0e095dddddf8198a38b380f04a9d463837ca8686.



Reason for revert: Caused exo_unittests failure crbug.com/1519021



Bug: 1519021



Original change's description:

> Make the event type check for d&d more explicit

>

> A user may release a mouse button that is not a part of d&d operation,

> and it can still cancel the drag and drop. Instead, explicitly check

> the left button (or other buttons), to decide if the drag and drop

> should be canceled.

>

> A few extra changes

> * Moved ShellClientData from shell_unittest.cc for reuse

> * Added wl_pointer support to TestClient

> * changed set_data so that it returns the pointer of moved object.

> I added DestroyData as template can't take nullptr any more.

> * Added generic button support to EventGenerator

>

entry.title: Use range-based iterator in AreFramesZero()
entry.content:
Surprisingly, using a range-based iterator is more performant than

two indices, according to this micro-benchmark [1]. The compiler might

fail to optimize away the unchanging pointer from the outer loop.



There are potentially still performance gains to be made in this

function, but start with the simplest guaranteed correct solution.



[1]: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5195411



Change-Id: I3ea9a6a3ba27386a342a39ee1707dc40b3c531a6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5202428

Commit-Queue: Dale Curtis

Auto-Submit: Thomas Guilbert

Reviewed-by: Dale Curtis

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1247890}

entry.title: [iOS blink] iOS platform-specific rebaseline due to font differences, part5.
entry.content:
This commit is the 5th in series of rebaselining expectations due to

font differences on iOS platform in text expectations.



Although we use the same web test fonts as the Mac port and

match font rendering to Mac styles, iOS defaults to "Times New Roman"

for the "Times" font.

These expectations are verified with those observed expectations

when MacPort uses "Times New Roman" for its font-family, as iOS.



- fast/forms/cursor-at-editable-content-boundary.html

- compositing/geometry/layer-due-to-layer-children-deep-switch.html

- compositing/geometry/layer-due-to-layer-children-switch.html

- paint/invalidation/flexbox/repaint.html

have been marked as 'Failure' due to the further investigation.



For more details on the Times vs Times New Roman issue,

please refer to this comment.[1]



[1] https://crbug.com/535893



Bug: 1421239

Change-Id: I013277ef38fef265ab010df235a0612e71d16ac9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5199407

Reviewed-by: Ian Vollick

Reviewed-by: Dominik Röttsches

Commit-Queue: Minju Kim

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1247883}

entry.title: MessagePumpEpoll: Enable MessagePumpEpoll by default on Linux/Android
entry.content:
This CL sets 'g_use_epoll' to TRUE to ensure the MessagePumpEpoll is

enabled by default on Linux/Android. This eliminates the need to

manually invoke `InitializeFeatures()` during process startup.



This CL also exports `kMessagePumpEpoll` for unit tests to set correct

feature state.



Bug: 1243354

Change-Id: I5a76b4dd0a52db43c724ead00a06ff498ce08718

entry.title: Revert "Automated T* -> raw_ptr<T> rewrite "refresh""
entry.content:
This reverts commit e407f3d9855a6a063eb8ea661a12b3f9d0a1e228.



Reason for revert: Cause of crbug.com/1518884



Original change's description:

> Automated T* -> raw_ptr rewrite "refresh"

>

> PS1: automated rewrite

> PS2-PS5,PS7: unrewrite to fix compilation

> PS6,PS22: unrewrite non-automated exclusions

> PS8-PS20: apply DanglingUntriaged

> PS21: unrewrite to undo binary size increase

> PS23: remove no-longer-needed RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION, #includes & comments

>

> The code has changed since the "big rewrite" so some exclusions no

> longer apply. But also, the rewriter changed too:

> - No longer applies constexpr-related exclusions (raw_ptr<> support

>   was added)

> - union exclusion has been waived for std::optional and absl::variant,

>   since they invoke raw_ptr<>'s ctor/dtor correctly

> - Certain paths under //base are no longer need to be excluded, as

> PartitionAlloc/raw_ptr no longer depends on them

>

> This CL also tries to popularize a better format of exclusion reasoning

> comments, e.g.:

>   // RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION: #addr-of, #global-scope

>   // RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION: Performance reasons ...

>   // RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION: #addr-of; Also: Another reason

> One comment per block of fields will suffice, if the reason is the

> same throughout, and no other comments are added in between.

> This format has advantages, like brevity (no more "not a raw_ptr<>

> because" blurb), and improved scriptability.

>

> Bug: 1446392

> Change-Id: I784ff0e461b2105bc01ad7b8570bb462613b24ce

> DanglingUntriaged-notes: automated rewrite.

> AX-Relnotes: n/a.

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5190661

> Reviewed-by: Keishi Hattori

> Commit-Queue: Bartek Nowierski

> Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

> Owners-Override: Keishi Hattori

> Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1247373}



Bug: 1446392, 1518884

entry.title: siso: canonicalize_dir for mojo actions
entry.content:
In reclient, python rewrapper config sets canonicalize_working_dir=true,

and some mojo action use this config via action_remote.py.

So it would be ok to use canonicalize_dir=true for siso native.



Also mojo_binding_generator doesn't use action_remote in siso/reproxy,

so set canonicalize_dir=true to make cache hit between different out

dir.



expect cache hit between release builder (out/Release) and debug builder (out/Debug).



Bug: b/312072730

Change-Id: I68f6d07597eac58a7223daa922ac78f532af128b

entry.title: Reland "Fix crash when triggering the ESB IPH Promo on a dangerous download"
entry.content:
The original CL was reverted due to a failing test case in which a race

condition can occur between the posttask function and the test execution.

The fix was that we needed to add a wait condition in our test case to

wait for the IPH to show up.



This is a reland of commit 63ba836b378f7575dcd4eca60afc5475d7a6f387



Original change's description:

> Fix crash when triggering the ESB IPH Promo on a dangerous download

>

> When a user tried to click away from the expanded partial view on a

> dangerous download, chrome would crash.

> Screencast:http://go/scrcast/NTMxMTY4Mzg2OTI3ODIwOHw0YmMxOWUxZC00ZQ

>

> The problem was that a function, `FocusAndActivateWindow` was being called reentrantly when it shouldn't have. We avoid that by using PostTask to make sure that each call to `FocusAndActivateWindow` finishes before another call can happen.

> Screencast:http://go/scrcast/NjU2MDI3NDM0ODc2OTI4MHxjNDM4NjQ5OC05OA

>

>

> Bug: 1517394

> Change-Id: I37fb9163c9c8235d070eb6505abea2508cdbe25a

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5190300

entry.title: Don't show tab strip context menus during tab drags
entry.content:
This fixes a regression introduced by [1]. The behavior on most

platforms (Windows, MacOS, Linux/Wayland) is to not show a menu

on right-mouse press and cancel the drag on right-mouse release.

This CL brings Linux/X11 behavior in line with the other platforms.



[1] https://crbug.com/1020316

entry.title: Mark LOG(FATAL) [[noreturn]]
entry.content:
This removes dead code as a result of making sure that the compiler

knows that LOG(FATAL) is [[noreturn]] directly within the translation

unit.



LOG(DFATAL) and DLOG(FATAL) are intentionally not [[noreturn]] as they

can't be in the release build.



Except for invariants already split out in crrev.com/c/5195484 it's not

trivial to me that any of the the remaining FATALs are invariant

failures within our code, so they were not updated to use CHECKs.
